Using what exactly? GNOME's Nautilus? Xfce's thing? Something else?
Try this now. umount it again, unplug, plug back in, wait for it to automount, see if it's readonly or not.

If it keeps working fine, then it was a corrupted filesystem. (FAT filesystems, including FAT32, are very unreliable. However, they're often used for speed and because they're easy to implement, as long as you don't annoy Micros~1 lawyers)
a) umount before unplugging, or b) use NTFS _and_ umount before unplugging.
